works.description:
The course includes Ashtanga yoga primary
 
series, Yoga Philosophy, Anatomy, Pranayama and different forms of  
Meditation like Osho Nadabrahma, Nataraj, Kundalini and Dynamic. An  
advanced course is also available and can be discussed with the teacher.  

The Pranayama classes cover various techniques like Kapalbhati, Bhastrika,
 
Sithali, Sithkari and Brahmari. Also, a brief explanation on the essence
of  
Bhagavad Gita will be discussed. Ayurveda and basic sanskrit language are 

taught on the weekends for those interested.

Mysore Style is practiced on saturdays where students get a chance to  
improve their practice without the teacher leading them. But the teacher  

will be present to adjust the postures.


Students are required to teach in small groups 2 or 3 asanas from second  

week onwards in the afternoon classes and a 45 min. session once at the
end  
of the second week. The final assessment will be will be conducted at the 

end of the course for certification.
Since, our course is based on practical approach, at the end of the course
 
students shall be confident to lead the class and also have improved their
 
own practice.

The eligibility for this course is a sincere desire to learn and
discipline  
to attend all the classes. Previous experience in Ashtanga or Hatha yoga
is  
preferred but not a must.
